alert.note: Alert for Brazoria; Galveston (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 6:17PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria, Galveston and Harris. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pasadena, northeastern Pearland, northern League City, western Baytown, northern Friendswood, La Porte, Deer Park, South Houston, West University Place, Seabrook, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Webster, Jersey Village, Hunters Creek Village, Kemah, Second Ward, Greater Fifth Ward, Greater Eastwood and Downtown Houston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
